intro: Justicia pynaertii, commonly known as the African flame plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Justicia pynaertii is drought-tolerant and suitable for xeriscaping in arid climates.
